headline.print_headline: New U.S. Diet Rules Would Take 20 Percent Bite Out of American Sugar Use
headline.main: New U.S. Diet Rules Would Take 20 Percent Bite Out of American Sugar Use

docs.lead_paragraph: If the U.S. government has its way, Americans would cut their consumption of sugar and corn syrup by more than 2 million tonnes a year, the latest blow for a sweetener industry facing an onslaught of criticism over negative health effects.
docs.snippet: If the U.S. government has its way, Americans would cut their consumption of sugar and corn syrup by more than 2 million tonnes a year, the latest blow for a sweetener industry facing an onslaught of criticism over negative health effects.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Cracks Down on Americans' Intake of Sugar, Saturated Fat
headline.main: U.S. Cracks Down on Americans' Intake of Sugar, Saturated Fat

docs.lead_paragraph: New U.S. dietary guidelines on Thursday urged Americans to cut their sugar and saturated fat intake to less than 10 percent of daily calories, but consumer advocates said the curbs did not provide clear guidance on the need to lower consumption of meat.
docs.snippet: New U.S. dietary guidelines on Thursday urged Americans to cut their sugar and saturated fat intake to less than 10 percent of daily calories, but consumer advocates said the curbs did not provide clear guidance on the need to lower consumption of...

headline.print_headline: Hold the 16-Oz Drink, Limit Salt _ Gov't Offers Guidelines
headline.main: Hold the 16-Oz Drink, Limit Salt _ Gov't Offers Guidelines

docs.lead_paragraph: Better cut down on sugar, especially those 16-ounce drinks, and limit your salt. But you might not need to worry quite as much about eggs.
docs.snippet: Better cut down on sugar, especially those 16-ounce drinks, and limit your salt. But you might not need to worry quite as much about eggs.

headline.print_headline: New Dietary Guidelines Urge Sharp Cuts in Sugar
headline.main: New Dietary Guidelines Urge Less Sugar for All and Less Protein for Boys and Men

docs.abstract: New federal dietary guidelines announced on Thursday urge Americans to drastically cut back on sugar, and for the first time have singled out teenage boys and men for eating too much meat.
docs.snippet: New federal dietary guidelines announced on Thursday urge Americans to drastically cut back on sugar, and for the first time have singled out teenage boys and men for eating too much meat.

headline.main: Mexican Soda Tax Followed by Drop in Sugary Drink Sales

docs.abstract: A tax on sugary drinks in Mexico appears to have had a significant impact: After one year, a new study found, sales of sugary beverages in Mexico fell while bottled water purchases rose.
docs.snippet: A tax on sugary drinks in Mexico appears to have had a significant impact: After one year, a new study found, sales of sugary beverages in Mexico fell while bottled water purchases rose.

headline.print_headline: Reimagining Fresh Produce in a Mostly Frozen State
headline.main: Closing the Farm-to-Table Gap in Alaska

docs.abstract: Alaskan companies Alaska Natural Organics and Vertical Harvest Hydroponics offer innovative ways to grow produce year round, despite state's harsh and extreme weather conditions, in efforts to improve quality of fresh fruits and vegetables available to residents and make them far more affordable.
docs.lead_paragraph: The quest for a crisp head of lettuce has opened the door to two start-ups with starkly different visions for growing fresh produce in a frozen state.
docs.snippet: The quest for a crisp head of lettuce has opened the door to two start-ups with starkly different visions for growing fresh produce in a frozen state.

headline.main: A Healthy Diet’s Main Ingredients? Best Guesses

docs.lead_paragraph: As the federal government is again rethinking the Dietary Guidelines for Americans, there’s fresh debate over just what makes a healthy diet.
docs.snippet: As the federal government is again rethinking the Dietary Guidelines for Americans, there’s fresh debate over just what makes a healthy diet.

headline.main: ‘The Diet Myth,’ ‘The Good Gut’ and ‘The Hidden Half of Nature’

docs.abstract: Sonia Shah reviews books The Diet Myth: Why the Secret to Health and Weight Loss Is Already in Your Gut by Tim Spector, The Good Gut: Taking Control of Your Weight, Your Mood, and Your Long-Term Health by Justin and Erica Sonnenburg and The Hidden Half of Nature: The Microbial Roots of Life and Health by David R Montgomery and Anne Bikle.
docs.lead_paragraph: Three books report on the microscopic creatures that live in our bodies, and their influence on how we function.
docs.snippet: Three books report on the microscopic creatures that live in our bodies, and their influence on how we function.

headline.print_headline: White House South Lawn Becomes First Lady's Grassy Stage
headline.main: White House South Lawn Becomes First Lady's Grassy Stage

docs.lead_paragraph: Michelle Obama's affection for the White House South Lawn has grown just like the sweet potatoes and carrots she plants there.
docs.snippet: Michelle Obama's affection for the White House South Lawn has grown just like the sweet potatoes and carrots she plants there.
